disease: Far Eastern tick-borne encephalitis (Russian spring-summer encephalitis)

symptoms.name: Meningitis
symptoms.pattern: Biphasic in approximately two-thirds of patients

symptoms.name: Meningoencephalitis
symptoms.pattern: Can occur with or without paralysis

symptoms.name: Post-encephalitic syndrome
symptoms.pattern: Develops in up to 50% of patients after acute illness

serum IgM and IgG antibodies.abnormal_range: Presence of specific antibodies indicates infection

cerebrospinal fluid IgM and IgG antibodi.abnormal_range: Presence of specific antibodies indicates infection

risk_factors: Consumption of unpasteurized milk or milk products from infected livestock
Living in or visiting tick-borne encephalitis endemic areas

required: Clinical presentation consistent with tick-borne encephalitis
supportive: Detection of specific IgM and IgG antibodies in serum and/or cerebrospinal fluid
